Node.definition: = a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations
= valley; Valley of Vision; ≈ apparently refers to Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= the structure forming the upper covering of a building, usually built as a terrace, to which one goes up by stairs
= action by which humans speak loudly
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to be in tumult|to be in uproar|to be loud
Node.definition: = action by which humans speak loudly, ≈ often associated with a lack of wisdom

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object
= state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= a person who is acknowledged by a group as having authority over them ► to provide leadership, often in battle, and justice
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war

= causative action by which humans hold other humans under control, either in a prison or in another situation in which that person does not have the freedom to act and go at will; ≈ regarded as hardship
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

= causative action by which humans hold other humans under control, either in a prison or in another situation in which that person does not have the freedom to act and go at will; ≈ regarded as hardship
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= state in which humans to feel pressed to act

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
singular only: = the population of a certain location, town, or ethnic group, ◄ referred to as the daughter of that location, town, or ethnic group

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= process by which humans are shaken out of a state of complacency and routine, ◄ as a result of a certain event
= act of treading heavily and noisily on somebody or something; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating
= state in which humans are so much affected by certain circumstances that they do not know what to do
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations
= valley; Valley of Vision; ≈ apparently refers to Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)

Node.gloss: to batter|to knock down|to beat down
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans strike an object or person repeatedly with hard blows ► in order to destroy or kill it
= flat construction, ◄ normally made of stone, ► used as a divider of spaces, or to enclose a space
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= nation ◄ located between Mesopotamia (אֲרַם נַהֲרַיִם) and Persia (פָּרַס) regarded as founded by a person with the same name

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= long, narrow container ► for storing one's arrows
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= soldier riding a horse
= region; ◄ of Assyria (אַשּׁוּר) ► to which Syrians (אֲרַמִּי) were taken as captives
= causative action by which humans or deities cause the outer layer covering an object to be removed

= a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God
= state in which persons or objects have been selected for their superior competencies or quality
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= a group of chariots (מֶרְכָּבָה) usually owned by one single person
= soldier riding a horse
= action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration
= action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

= causative action by which someone causes someone else to take off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which brings shame on that person and to those who stand in a close relation to them

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a relatively large piece of cloth, ► used to close off the entrance to (part of) a tent, or, more generally, as a covering

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: to look at; hence: = action by which humans or deities pay attention to certain matters

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= class of tools designed to attack and inflict bodily harm on someone else or to defend oneself against similar attacks from other people

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

Node.gloss: House of the Forest of Lebanon
Node.definition: literally: House of the Forest of Lebanon = a very large building in Jerusalem built by King Solomon, which consisted of four rows of pillars of cedar wood; this cedar wood likely came from the forests of Lebanon, located north of Israel

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= place where a construction has been damaged and needs repair
= area within a town, in most cases protected by its own wall
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency
= causative action by which humans gather inanimate objects from different sources to keep for oneself or store it

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= relatively large reservoir ◄ dug by human hands ► to collect water; place where many public activities take place

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons or objects

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which someone causes something else to be beyond the reach of others, such as enemies, by making it strong and inaccessible

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= basin constructed for the storage of water
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= the area separating two or mores locations

= structure surrounding a building, a collection of buildings, or a town; ◄ made out of stone; ► provides protection; ≈ associated with strength, safety, and the ability to resist attacks from outside
= relatively large reservoir ◄ dug by human hands ► to collect water; place where many public activities take place
= name of pool in Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם)
literally: to look at; hence: = action by which humans or deities pay attention to certain matters
literally: to make (plans); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities conceive events in their minds, ◄ described as an craftsperson producing an artifact
= causative action by which deities conceive events in their minds, ◄ described as an artisan shaping clay into an artifact

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities make a public announcement
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

= mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning

Node.gloss: to gird oneself|to put on (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = action by which someone ties a belt or piece of cloth around the waist; hence also: to put on clothes or armor
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a reference to the day after the current day
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
literally: to uncover (someone's) ear; hence: = causative action by which a deity or human being discloses previously unknown information to someone else
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= action by which deities do not hold wrongdoers any longer responsible for certain actions, often as a result of an atonement ritual or a change in behavior of the guilty party
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= man; ► official; time of king Hezekiah (חִזְקִיָּהוּ)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to hew out|to dig|to cut out|to dress|to mine
Node.definition: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

Node.gloss: to hew out|to dig|to cut out|to dress|to mine
Node.definition: = action by which humans strike an object repeatedly with an axe, chisel, or other sharp implement, ► in order to alter its shape and so create a new object out of it

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= to construct by making cuts in stone
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans throw an object in a certain direction, often with force
= causative action by which humans throw an object in a certain direction, often with force
= a male human
= action by which humans put on a piece of clothing by wrapping it around their body
= action by which humans put on a piece of clothing by wrapping it around their body
= action by which humans roll something into a ball shape
= action by which humans roll something into a ball shape
= cloth wound around the head
exact meaning unsure; probably: = a round solid object which can be easily rolled, kicked, or thrown

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: wide of hands; hence: = state in which a certain object has a relatively large distance from side to side
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= open vehicle with two or four wheels, pulled by one or more horses; ◄ made or wood and iron; ► used in war or for travelling
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= person who brings disdain from the general public on someone else ◄ by his behavior
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= causative action by which someone causes others to move away from a certain place by force, ◄ as if by physically pushing them away

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= man; ◄ son of Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּהוּ) ► official; time of king Hezekiah (חִזְקִיָּהוּ)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Shallum (שַׁלּוּם) ► high priest (כֹּהֵן) time of king Hezekiah (חִזְקִיָּהוּ)
= causative action by which humans help other humans to put on clothes
= long robe with sleeves ► often worn by young unmarried men and women; ≈ considered valuable
= strip ◄ of cloth ► worn around the waist as part of one's uniform

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to give strength, to fortify|to repair|to let prevail
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause humans and objects to be strong in a physical, political, or military sense
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= a person, ◄ compared to a father, ► who provides care for the people under his authority; ≈ often extended to refer to God
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

= tool of a relatively small size, flat in shape with a number of small projections on one side, corresponding an equal number of holes in the bolt of a door;◄ made of wood or metal; ► used for removing the bolt from the outside by inserting it through a hole in the door; ≈ being entrusted with the key to an important building gives a certain amount of status and power
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= the upper part of the human body between the head and the chest; ≈ associated with heavy burdens, and, in a more figurative way, heave responsibilities

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a door (דֶּלֶת)
= causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a door (דֶּלֶת)

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= causative action by which humans or deities allow others entrance, passage, or access (in)to a building, construction, or area ◄ by withdrawing a gate, door, window, lid, covering, or other boundary; ≈ sometimes associated with freedom, sometimes with being exposed, vulnerable
= causative action by which someone causes a sharp object to penetrate another object
= small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security
= state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move
the throne representing someone's position as monarch or judge
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= a group of people to which one traces one's ancestry; ◄ smallest unit within family group
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= a group of people to which one traces one's ancestry; ◄ smallest unit within family group
= one's children including their respective offspring ◄ literally referred to as those who come forth from someone
= object which derives from or comes from another object
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= state in which animate or inanimate objects are relatively small in size, ≈ which is sometimes associated with a lack of strength, and with insignificance
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= container; ► used for storing blood (דָּם) and/or wine (מֶזֶג)
particle linking two objects, of which the first is not always listed explicitly; = relation indicating that object X and object Y are at opposite ends of a range of similar objects
= human made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes
= earthenware vessel, ► used as a storage container for liquids like wine and olive oil

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= process why which an object gets detached from the place where it has been fixed
= small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security
= causative action by which someone causes a sharp object to penetrate another object
= state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move
= process by which part of an object, without apparent human intervention, detaches itself from a larger unit, so that it falls to the ground
= process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control
= causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
